summary: Detective April Marshall investigates a cold case involving an armed robbery and homicide from 2002 after a Glock 17 pistol is found and linked to the case. The investigation leads to Gerald Gillespie, who possesses a pocket watch matching the description of a stolen item from the incident. Buccal swab and fingerprint standards are collected from Mr. Gillespie for forensic analysis.
conclusion: No further action was taken after collecting forensic samples from Gerald Gillespie and resubmitting the fired cartridge case for comparison.
